alert.note: Alert for Randolph; Upshur; Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 2:58PM EDT until August 04 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Randolph County in northeastern West Virginia... South Central Upshur County in northeastern West Virginia... Northeastern Webster County in northeastern West Virginia... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mill Creek, Holly River State Park, Dailey, Huttonsville, Helvetia, Pickens, Hacker Valley and Diana. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
